<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=4994) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=734" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=735" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 186 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Trigger**
A creature Casts a Spell that you have prepared

</column>

---

When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your magic to disrupt it. You expend a prepared spell to counter the triggering creature's casting of that same spell. You lose your spell slot as if you had cast the triggering spell. You then attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=3280) the triggering spell.

**Special** This feat has the trait corresponding to the tradition of spells you cast (arcane, divine, primal, or occult).

<title level="2">Counterspell leads to...</title>
[Clever Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=5041), [Reflect Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=5016), [Sin Counterspell](/Feats.aspx?ID=7488)
name: Counterspell
